restrict: ◎必須先修過【英文（一）】◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description: 在出國旅遊如此盛行的年代，如果可以更加確實地掌握觀光英語，除了能增加旅遊的方便性，也更能幫助我們理解其他國家的文化。本課程為欲學習觀光英語及相關旅遊知識的人所設計，其最大特色在協助修課學生日後出國旅遊之時，能夠更有勇氣與自信開口說英文。甚至讓有志者將來從事觀光旅遊業時，具備基本的觀光英語專業知識與溝通表達之技能。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

E-mail: [tcsu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:tcsu@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Course Objective**

This course aims to build and strengthen students’ overall travel English proficiency. It is an elective English for specific purposes (ESP) course designed to raise students’ interest and understanding of traveling and English related to travel business or the hospitality industry, including lodging, food and drink service, event planning, theme parks, transportation, cruise line, traveling and additional fields within the tourism industry. Through extensive course works, students shall be able: (1) to broaden students’ vocabulary bank and sentence patterns in travel English, (2) to improve students’ oral communicative skills and survival English to function effectively in English-speaking countries when they travel abroad, (3) to provide students with real-life situations and authentic materials such as tour brochures, (4) to help students learn how to introduce their home culture and to appreciate other cultures, (5) to facilitate their acquisition of intercultural communicative competence, (6) to understand tour itinerary and create tour schedule, and (7) to enable students to explore tourist industry and foreign culture resources independently. The course is conducted mostly in English, through lectures using multimedia aids and devices, group activities and projects, and student reports and presentations. Students are encouraged to take active participations in both in-class and after-class language practices and activities.

**Required Textbooks**

Cheng, Kiwi。《觀光英語 Let’s Go!》。第三版。台北市：寂天文化，2017。

Course Requirements and Evaluation

1.  Attendance and Preparation: Students are expected to attend the class well prepared, and to arrive to class on time. Tardiness and absences will affect your final grade. If you miss the class on more than three occasions, you will fail the course. (Official documentation is required for an absence.)
2.  Class Participation and presentations: Active participations in class activities and language practices will foster your real-time communication skills and critical thinking, which will lead to a greater improvement in your English language learning. Therefore, you are required to actively participate in classroom activities such as pair/group discussions and make multiple oral presentations on assigned or chosen topics. In this semester, students are required to fulfill the following obligations:
